stronger.description: Foregrounds in low emphasis status indicators

zero.description: Use to set a media query `min-width` below small.

s.description: The `min-width` for mobile devices, such as phones and tablets.

xl.description: Used for extra large screens, such as wide monitors and TVs.

5.description:
Banners, Snackbars, Toast Messages, Non modal Dialogs, 
Side Panels (when opacity overlay behaviour is not applied)

6.description:
Modal Dialogs, Side Panels (when opacity overlay behaviour
is applied)

zero.description: This is the initial shape of every new element. Use this for backgrounds screens and fixed navigation containers such as headers, and side-panels.

half.description: Use this for subtle and small components that don’t require to group complex information like Status Indicators, Checkboxes and Color Swatches.

x1.description: Use this for form components presenting text information or inputs: Text Inputs and Text Area, Dropdowns, Menus and Banners.

x2.description: Use this for all the containers and popups: All Cards, Modals, Tooltips and Toasts.

round.description: Commonly used for our standard buttons and profile avatars: All Primary, Secondary Buttons, Radio Buttons and Notification Badges.

x1.description: Compact spacing between text or icons

x2.description: Commonly used to group compact elements like icon buttons

x3.description: Use when compact padding is required

x4.description: Default space token. Used to group Inputs with related data

x6.description:
• Padding around card content
• Related elements where more space between them can be afforded
• Separate section headings or titles from body text or inputs

x8.description:
• Standard spacing between cards
• Used to separate groups of content 
• Separate section headings or titles from body text or inputs

x10.description:
• Used for outer margins on the overall page content 
• Used for inner margins on large items such as page sections

x16.description:
- Use to de-clutter your UI when a lot of space is available
- Separate banner sections from page content
- Use to differentiate page content like page sections

x20.description:
- Use sparingly
- Helps to put focus on the primary element within your page
- Use to de-clutter your UI when a lot of space is available
